Class BigNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • BigNumber

  • public class BigNumber
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that can contain crazy big numbers and perform basic arithmetic operations.
    Author:
    Jamie Walder, Mantas Pileckis, Justin Davis

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • BigNumber

        public BigNumber(long num)
        Creates a new big number based on a long.
        Parameters:
        num - number this big number will be based off of.

      • BigNumber

        public BigNumber(int numberOfDigits,
                 int fillNum)
        Creates a buffer with a specified number of digits. If numberOfDigits is less than 0, fillNum less than 0, or fillNum greater than 10 the user is notified of an error.
        Parameters:
        numberOfDigits - the number of digits the number will have.
        fillNum - the int that will be used to fill the buffer.

      • BigNumber

        public BigNumber(java.lang.String number)
        Creates a big number based off a string input and then fills the buffer accordingly.
        Parameters:
        number - the string of the number that will be inputed.

      • BigNumber

        public BigNumber(BigNumber bn)
        Creates a big number based on another big number.
        Parameters:
        bn - big number we are using to create another big number.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the result of the tens complement.

        Divides two bigNumbers
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Estimates the square root of a big number using the Babylonian method and returns it.
        Returns:
        the result of the square root estimation.

      • factors

      • equals

        public boolean equals(BigNumber bigNumber)
        Compares two big numbers to see if they are equal. Returns a boolean to represent the comparison.
        Parameters:
        bigNumber - the big number being compared to this number.
        Returns:
        a boolean whether or not two big numbers are equal. True if equal, false if not.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(BigNumber bigNumber)
        Compares two big numbers together and returns an integer result based on that comparison.
        Parameters:
        bigNumber - the big number to be compared to this number.
        Returns:
        -1 if this big number is less than the number being compared, 0 if both numbers are equal, or 1 if this number is larger than the number being compared.

      • negate

        public void negate()
        Negates the big number. If positive becomes negative, or if negative becomes positive.

      • sign

        public int sign()
        Returns an integer to represent the sign of a big number.
        Returns:
        an int representing the sign of the big number; +1 if positive or 0, -1 if negative.

      • numDigits

        public int numDigits()

        the number of digits in our big number.
